meanings.sent1: The doctor said I was asymptomatic, which meant I didn't feel sick.
meanings.sent2: She was asymptomatic, so she didn't realize she was carrying the virus.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was asymptomatic, he still had to stay home to avoid spreading germs.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as asymptomatic as her calm demeanor, hiding any hint of worry.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked asymptomatic of any pests, but the flowers were secretly wilting.

meanings.definition: Not exhibiting any signs of illness.
meanings.sent1: The test results showed he was asymptomatic, even though he felt fine.
meanings.sent2: The cat appeared asymptomatic, but the vet detected an underlying issue.
meanings.sent3: The party was asymptomatic of any drama, making it a peaceful gathering.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as asymptomatic as her face, giving no clue to her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The painting was asymptomatic of the artist's inner turmoil, masking a deeper meaning.
